bf6970d9-cd9e-46be-9ab7-50d4e24da8e6.description: This Leadership Program is a series of six seminars designed to help individuals enhance their professional and personal skill sets. This highly interactive program is designed to develop stronger and better working relationships and ultimately increase teamwork and collaboration on campus and beyond. Participants will develop improved communication skills, conflict resolution techniques, mindfulness practices, and relationship building expertise in order to enhance their leadership development.
bf6970d9-cd9e-46be-9ab7-50d4e24da8e6.name: Leadership Development Program

badge_template_activities.title: Complete True Colors personality assessment.
Complete Decision-Making Questionnaire assessment.
Complete Myer-Briggs Type Indicator questionnaire.
Participate in active listening exercise.
Complete 360 evaluation.
Participate in a group project aimed at developing and implementing a campus improvement initiative. Present this project to senior leadership.

98ed36ff-ae30-4cc7-ab16-3940b8ff9fbf.description: The introductory session of pottery class gives students a survey of the techniques and tools used to create pottery. Students will become familiar with stages in the process of working with clay, including making, drying, firing, and glazing. Creative expression through the medium of clay will be explored and encouraged in this friendly and supportive environment.
98ed36ff-ae30-4cc7-ab16-3940b8ff9fbf.name: Introduction to Pottery

badge_template_activities.title: Create and glaze a pinch pot
Create and glaze a coil-built piece
Create and glaze one or more basic slab-built pieces, including trays, bowls, vases, mugs
Throwing pots on the wheel

c7c2d92e-fcd2-467b-bafd-38b3493d9371.description: This badge earner completed a 3-step process to become a Mercy Associate. They entered into a covenant with the Sisters of Mercy based on the shared values and traditions of Catherine McAuley. They pledged to support the SOM in their mission, ministries, and spirituality by focusing on the critical needs of our time: care of Earth, anti-racism advocacy, justice for women, justice for immigrants, and non-violence. They demonstrate their love of Christ in service to the poor, sick, & uneducated.
c7c2d92e-fcd2-467b-bafd-38b3493d9371.name: Mercy Associate

badge_template_activities.title: The pre-associate, in consultation with a mentor, discerns a call to begin the formal orientation process and submits Form 400: Mercy Association Interest Form

Upon completion of orientation, the pre-associate and Local Area Facilitator submit the the following forms to the Office of Association 10-12 weeks prior to a covenant date. Form 401: Mercy Association Application, Form 402: Discernment Questions, Form 406: Consent/Release and Communications Agreement, Form 404: LAF Recommendation Form

Once all documentation has been approved by the Office of Association a covenant date is established and the individual enters into their formal agreement with the Sisters of Mercy as a Mercy Associate.

d00aa8bb-eb7d-4c0c-aef9-c617bfddb0c0.description: The intermediate wheel throwing clay badge is for students who have improved upon and added to their beginner wheel throwing skills. Through continued practice and a focus on more advanced craftsmanship, students gained competency at throwing, trimming, and glazing fundamental pottery forms.
d00aa8bb-eb7d-4c0c-aef9-c617bfddb0c0.name: Intermediate Wheel Throwing

badge_template_activities.title: Complete a mug and bowl on the wheel
Trim thrown forms on the wheel
Experiment with wax, iron oxide, underglazes, layering glazes
Practice pulled handles
Begin shaping forms such as pitchers and vases

334a1d72-aa11-44cb-a683-ad52157b6c0f.description: The intermediate hand building clay badge is for students who have improved on and added to their beginner hand building skills. These students utilized the many skills developed in the introductory class to focus on more advanced craftsmanship skills such as coils, slabs, extruding, and other intermediate techniques while creating more challenging and complex projects.
334a1d72-aa11-44cb-a683-ad52157b6c0f.name: Intermediate Hand Building

badge_template_activities.title: Demonstrate use of extruded attachments
Complete intermediate project such as lidded box, butter dish or equivalent
Experiment with wax, iron oxide, underglazes, layering glazes
Begin refinement of craftsmanship

e9560807-5383-434e-86f3-d401f711fb78.description: The advanced wheel throwing clay badge is for students who have practiced and further refined their wheel throwing skills. Through continued practice on the wheel, advanced wheel throwers have learned what it takes to create well-crafted multi-piece thrown pottery. Advanced wheel throwing students are beginning to purposefully explore and create their own distinct artistic style.
e9560807-5383-434e-86f3-d401f711fb78.name: Advanced Wheel Throwing

badge_template_activities.title: throw, trim and glaze complex forms such as lidded jars, large bowls, plates, teapots
refine pulled handles
experiment with slips, sgraffito
refine craftsmanship & glazing
begin development of personal style

411dcde4-fbbf-46a9-b499-f258a02b8b6b.description: The advanced hand building clay badge is for students who have taken their intermediate hand building skills to the next level. Through continued practice of slab and/or coil building pottery, advanced hand builders have learned the skills necessary to create well-crafted multi-piece hand built forms. Advanced hand building students are beginning to purposefully explore and create their own distinct artistic style.
411dcde4-fbbf-46a9-b499-f258a02b8b6b.name: Advanced Hand Building

badge_template_activities.title: complete a multi-part hand built piece such as teapot, watering can or equivalent
experiment with slips and sgraffito
continue to refine craftsmanship & glazing
begin development of personal style

321c7d6a-7811-4369-8980-a3072c42c14c.description: This badge earner has attended multiple diversity workshops and can demonstrate awareness, respect, and understanding of the dimensions of diversity and inclusion that are different from their own. They can apply knowledge of diversity, inclusion, oppression, and intersectionality to reflect on their own practices, while developing inclusive and equitable practices that foster belonging and remove barriers for underrepresented communities.
321c7d6a-7811-4369-8980-a3072c42c14c.name: Diversity Workshop Series

badge_template_activities.title: Attend 3 or more Diversity Workshops

Complete a reflection summary to identify and explore the construct of intersectionality, and cultivate and apply intercultural communications skills to learn about differences in a culturally appropriate and mindful manner.

Complete a reflection summary to develop knowledge and understanding of the basic principles of inclusion and apply strategies for building inclusive relationships in the classroom, programs, and organizations.

Complete a reflection summary to develop equity-mindedness to erase social injustices and disparities, deconstruct and critically think about systemic cycles of oppression, and identify, apply, and practice social sustainability and equity.

Complete a reflection summary to understand and identify internal and external disabilities and be able to adeptly meet the needs of people with disabilities, and develop a comprehensive understanding of integrating accessibility standards into programming, curriculum, and instructional design and technology.

fa63edfa-67bd-40f3-b89b-ae2017e2e614.description: Students can comprehend and complete analyses using simple descriptive statistical methods of both graphical and numerical nature. They have a foundational understanding of probability, including counting techniques and random variables. Students comprehend the use of and analyze data using the basic inferential statistics techniques: Estimation, Hypothesis Testing, Linear Regression, Goodness of Fit, and ANOVA. Students have been introduced to some basic non-parametric methods.
fa63edfa-67bd-40f3-b89b-ae2017e2e614.name: Elementary Descriptive and Inferential Statistics

badge_template_activities.title: Earning a B- or better in Math 115: Basic Statistics. This 3 credit course is an introduction to the use of statistical methods with emphasis on practical applications. Descriptive statistics, introduction to probability, estimation of parameters, introduction to hypothesis testing, correlation, and linear regression.

Earning a B- or better in Math 116: Basic Statistics II. This 3 credit course introduces students to hypothesis testing, analysis of variance, correlation and regression analysis, nonparametric statistics.

96f2354b-37b0-4099-947d-ae2fa6bf661c.description: This badge earner has been elected to serve as Administrative Coordinator of the Misericordia University Student Government Association (SGA) by handling all outgoing communications of the Student Government, maintaining accurate records of communications, recording official minutes of all Student Government meetings, coordinating meeting locations including reservations, set up, and communication plans. The SGA is guided by the concepts of Mercy, Service, Justice, and Hospitality.
96f2354b-37b0-4099-947d-ae2fa6bf661c.name: Student Government Administrative Coordinator

badge_template_activities.title: Attend one-hour weekly meetings with Student Government Board members. Attend one-hour monthly meetings with the University’s Executive Cabinet. Attend one-hour monthly meetings with the University’s Council of Clubs. Hold 2 one-hour townhall meetings each semester for the entire student body.

Handle all outgoing communications of the Student Government and maintain accurate records of said communications. Record official minutes of all Student Government meetings and forward them to the archives at the end of each academic year. Coordinate meeting locations (including reservations, set up, and communication plans) and in collaboration with the President and Vice President. Represent the student body on any administrative committees as requested by the SGA President.

ae71fcf8-f58f-4bca-a0c4-74f92d4510a4.description: This badge earner has been elected to serve as President of the Misericordia University Student Government Association (SGA) to advocate and represent the student body by listening to the needs and concerns of the students and working with the University administration in order to build a better living/learning environment for all students. The SGA is guided by the concepts of Mercy, Service, Justice, and Hospitality.
ae71fcf8-f58f-4bca-a0c4-74f92d4510a4.name: Student Government President

badge_template_activities.title: Attend one-hour weekly meetings with Student Government Board members. Attend one-hour monthly meetings with the University’s Executive Cabinet. Attend one-hour monthly meetings with the University’s Council of Clubs. Attend monthly meetings with the Vice President of Mission Integration and Student Life and the Dean of Students.

Hold 2 one-hour town hall meetings each semester for the entire student body. Represent student body at the 3 annual Board of Trustees meetings. Represent the student body on any administrative committees as requested by the University administration.

0e86f1f3-8453-4c10-b949-305ac08b0a00.description: This badge earner has been elected to serve as Treasurer of the Misericordia University Student Government Association (SGA) and keep accurate records of all financial transactions, prepare the student government budget, and organize and implement the inter-club loan system. The SGA is guided by the concepts of Mercy, Service, Justice, and Hospitality.
0e86f1f3-8453-4c10-b949-305ac08b0a00.name: Student Government Treasurer

badge_template_activities.title: Attend one-hour weekly meetings with Student Government Board members. Attend one-hour monthly meetings with the University’s Executive Cabinet. Attend one-hour monthly meetings with the University’s Council of Clubs. Hold 2 one-hour town hall meetings each semester for the entire student body.

Sign all monetary disbursements of the Student Government from the Student Government Association account. Be responsible for the organization and implementation of an inter-club loan system through which the Student Government shall grant financial loans and grants to other chartered campus organizations. Represent the student body on any administrative committees as requested by the SGA President.

8faf1831-fdde-4369-9355-0196fc26c543.description: This badge earner has been elected to serve as Policy Liaison of the Misericordia University Student Government Association (SGA), act as parliamentarian of Student Government, participate with revisions to the Student Handbook, review disciplinary guidelines, be the keeper of the official Student Government Constitution, and ensure the constitutionality of all Student Government proposals and activities. The SGA is guided by the concepts of Mercy, Service, Justice, and Hospitality.
8faf1831-fdde-4369-9355-0196fc26c543.name: Student Government University Policy Liaison

badge_template_activities.title: Attend one-hour weekly meetings with Student Government Board members. Attend one-hour monthly meetings with the University’s Executive Cabinet. Attend one-hour monthly meetings with the University’s Council of Clubs. Hold 2 one-hour townhall meetings each semester for the entire student body.

Act as the parliamentarian of the Student Government, deal with all Student Government policy matters, and advise the Executive Board of all matters of procedural significance. Participate with the University administration in discussion of revisions to the Student Handbook and reviewing disciplinary guidelines for the student body.

Be the keeper of the official Student Government Constitution, make any necessary proposals, and ensure the constitutionality of all Student Government proposals and activities. Represent the student body on any administrative committees as requested by the SGA President.

20115cb9-628f-44eb-af86-62a402f5fe9f.description: This badge earner has been elected to serve as Vice President of the Misericordia University Student Government Association (SGA) to advocate and represent the student body by listening to the needs and concerns of the students and working with the University administration in order to build a better living/learning environment for all students. The SGA is guided by the concepts of Mercy, Service, Justice, and Hospitality.
20115cb9-628f-44eb-af86-62a402f5fe9f.name: Student Government Vice President

badge_template_activities.title: Attend one-hour weekly meetings with Student Government Board members. Attend one-hour monthly meetings with the University’s Executive Cabinet. Attend one-hour monthly meetings with the University’s Council of Clubs. The Vice President will act as the president of the Council of Clubs.

Hold 2 one-hour townhall meetings each semester for the entire student body. Attend monthly meetings with the Vice President of Mission Integration and Student Life and the Dean of Students. Represent student body at the 3 annual Board of Trustees meetings. Represent the student body on any administrative committees as requested by the SGA President.
